result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald T Andresen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan to commence 12/1/2015

SUBMIT DNA SAMPLE

COURT ORDERED FIREARM SEIZED IN THIS MATTER IS TO BE RETURNED TO JEREMIAH ANDRESEN

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald T Andresen

records.addlTxt:
to Court from Christina N Smith
taxes attached but not scanned (includes address-ss numbers)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judge said if $100 paid  reinstate the $50/mo payment plan or warrant will be reactivated if any payment is missed.

Defendant Ronald T Andresen in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to 947.01(1) - class B Misdemeanor.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to amended Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  Court questions Atty Gumz.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Amended Ct 1.
Arguments by counsel.  Defendant makes statement.  

BY THE COURT:
*Serve 5 days in the Marquette County Jail, consecutive to any sentence now serving.  *Granted 4 days credit.  *Sentence deemed served.  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample.  *Pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
*Payment Plan:  $50/month commencing 12/1/15 and will add the $15.00 payment plan fee.

Atty Hendee states there was a motion to return the firearm to Jeremiah Andresen.  State has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court will order that the firearm seized in this matter is to be returned to Jeremiah Andresen.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald T Andresen
Current: 3576 Zirbel Rd, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 10-22-2015)
Prior: 241 Lawrence St; Apt 201, Westfield, WI 53964

Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-22-2015 10:15 am.
Motion hearing at 10-22-2015 10:15 am.

Defendant Ronald T Andresen in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties are close to resolution.  Atty Gumz responds and asks for a motion date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Motion and Plea date.
bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:15 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that parties are close to resolution and asks for a reset.
Atty Gumz agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Ronald T Andresen in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Gumz is requesting additional discovery and the parties are requesting another return date.  Atty Gumz asks for it to be set fairly soon.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 06-23-2015 01:15 pm.
Return date at 07-23-2015 03:30 pm.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  Zero tolerance.  *Not possess a firearm during the pendency of this action.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court questions defendant on the waiver and finds it has been made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.

Defendant Ronald T Andresen by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Signature bond set.
Mr. Andresen states he has no other firearms at the home (officers took the one last evening)  Return date scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
